cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting north-northwest, forecast to bend northwest into the South Carolina coast this weekend, then turn north-northeast and lift along/just inland of the Carolina coast before curving offshore of the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina coast in the vicinity of Myrtle Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach, SC to Cape Lookout, NC (tropical-storm watch)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coast from South Carolina through North Carolina, then the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England waters as the system lifts northeastward
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible Monday with occasional gusts 25–35 mph as the storm passes well southeast of Delaware.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal departures (<2 ft) possible along Delaware Bay if onshore flow briefly develops, otherwise none expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Monday into early Tuesday as outer rain-bands brush the region.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf along Delaware beaches early next week.
